metadata.focus: Inclusive WordPress VAPT coverage with populated references
metadata.intended_use: Feed into WordPress Copilot for AI prompt generation and schema creation

wordpress_vapt.title: Weak password policy enforcement
wordpress_vapt.description: Weak or absent password policies allow trivial brute-force attacks and compromise accounts.
remediation: Enforce strong password rules (min length, complexity)

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate brute-force simulations and policy audit

wordpress_vapt.title: Default admin username present
wordpress_vapt.description: Predictable usernames increase brute-force success and targeted attacks.

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate user inventory and enumeration probes

wordpress_vapt.title: Missing MFA/2FA for privileged accounts
wordpress_vapt.description: Without MFA, compromised credentials lead directly to admin access.

wordpress_vapt.title: Brute-force login without rate limiting
wordpress_vapt.description: Lack of throttling and CAPTCHA enables automated credential attacks.

wordpress_vapt.title: Privilege escalation via misconfigured roles/capabilities
wordpress_vapt.description: Over-permissive capabilities allow lower roles to perform admin actions.
tests: Attempt sensitive actions with lower roles
Check custom roles added by plugins

wordpress_vapt.title: Missing secure cookie flags
wordpress_vapt.description: Cookies without Secure/HttpOnly/SameSite increase hijacking and CSRF risk.

wordpress_vapt.title: Session fixation (no rotation on privilege change)
wordpress_vapt.description: Failure to rotate session IDs on login or role change enables fixation attacks.

wordpress_vapt.title: SQL injection in custom queries
wordpress_vapt.description: Untrusted input reaching queries without prepared statements enables data compromise.

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate SQL payload sets and map sinks

wordpress_vapt.title: Stored XSS in comments/forms/meta
wordpress_vapt.description: Persistent scripts execute in user contexts, enabling account takeover and malware delivery.
tests: Inject stored XSS payloads in comments and custom fields
Check wp_kses() usage for HTML inputs
evidence: Code references to esc_* and wp_kses
remediation: Restrict HTML to safe tags via kses

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate XSS payloads and verify escaping

wordpress_vapt.title: Reflected XSS in query parameters and search forms
wordpress_vapt.description: Unescaped reflected input allows script execution in victims’ browsers.

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate template scans and reflected XSS probes

wordpress_vapt.title: CSRF on sensitive actions
wordpress_vapt.description: Missing nonce validation enables attackers to trigger privileged actions via crafted requests.
tests: Attempt CSRF on password reset, plugin install, settings changes
Verify nonce presence and server-side verification
assurance: Nonces required and verified for state changes
remediation: Add nonces to all state-changing actions

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate CSRF probes for sensitive actions

wordpress_vapt.title: Unvalidated redirects and phishing vectors
wordpress_vapt.description: Open redirects enable phishing and session hijacking via crafted links.
tests: Probe wp_redirect and custom redirect handlers

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate redirect probes and verify allowlists

references.name: OWASP Top 10
references.section: A01 Broken Access Control (open redirect impact)

wordpress_vapt.title: Unrestricted file uploads and executable handling
wordpress_vapt.description: Insufficient validation allows webshells or malware to be uploaded and executed.
tests: Check server-side MIME and extension validation
Verify PHP execution disabled in uploads

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate upload payloads to test validation and execution blocking
automation_prompts.ai_ui: Upload policy editor with live tests

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure file permissions
wordpress_vapt.description: World-readable or writable sensitive files (e.g., wp-config.php) enable compromise.
tests: Audit permissions for wp-config.php and key directories

wordpress_vapt.title: Publicly accessible backups and exports
wordpress_vapt.description: Exposed archives or DB dumps leak credentials and PII.

wordpress_vapt.title: REST API authorization failures
wordpress_vapt.description: Missing or incorrect permission checks allow unauthorized data access or state changes.
tests: Probe custom routes with unauthenticated and low-privilege roles
Check nonce and capability enforcement for write operations

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate role-based probes for REST routes

wordpress_vapt.title: REST API data exposure
wordpress_vapt.description: Excessive fields or user enumeration via REST leak sensitive data.
tests: Inspect fields returned by public endpoints
assurance: No sensitive fields in public endpoints

wordpress_vapt.title: XML-RPC abuse and exposure
wordpress_vapt.description: Unrestricted XML-RPC enables brute force, pingback DDoS, and unintended actions.

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate XML-RPC probes and rate-limit tests

wordpress_vapt.title: API token leakage and improper storage
wordpress_vapt.description: Tokens stored in plaintext or exposed via REST, logs, or client-side code enable unauthorized access.
tests: Scan codebase and options table for tokens/keys
Inspect logs and debug output for sensitive values
assurance: Tokens stored server-side with restricted access
No secrets in client-side code or REST responses
remediation: Mask tokens in logs and responses

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate secret pattern scans across code, DB, and REST

controls.label: Enable Token Encryption
controls.help_text: Ensure all API tokens are encrypted before storage to prevent plaintext exposure.

controls.label: Encryption Key Reference
controls.help_text: Specify the key identifier or reference used for token encryption.

controls.label: Secure Storage Method
controls.help_text: Select the secure storage mechanism for tokens.

controls.label: Disable Token Logging
controls.help_text: Prevent tokens from being written to logs or console output.

controls.label: Restrict Client-Side Token Exposure
controls.help_text: Block tokens from being exposed in client-side code or browser storage.

controls.label: Scan Application Logs for Tokens
controls.help_text: Run a test to detect if tokens are present in application logs.

controls.label: Intercept REST API Responses
controls.help_text: Verify if tokens are exposed in REST API responses or request payloads.

controls.label: Analyze Client-Side Code
controls.help_text: Check client-side scripts and storage for hardcoded or leaked tokens.

controls.label: Validate Token Encryption
controls.help_text: Confirm that stored tokens are encrypted and not retrievable in plaintext.

controls.label: Simulate Unauthorized Access Attempt
controls.help_text: Attempt to use exposed tokens to confirm that leakage leads to unauthorized access.

wordpress_vapt.title: Webhook replay protection missing
wordpress_vapt.description: Absent timestamps, signatures, or idempotency keys allow replay attacks.

wordpress_vapt.title: OAuth/SSO misconfigurations
wordpress_vapt.description: Missing state/nonce, token replay, or excessive scopes enable account compromise.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure caching of authenticated or sensitive content
wordpress_vapt.description: Misconfigured caches can serve private data to unauthorized users or leak session state.
tests: Check cache headers for authenticated pages
Probe CDN/edge cache behavior with role changes
Validate cache key segmentation by auth state
assurance: Authenticated content is never publicly cached
remediation: Set strict cache headers for sensitive routes

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate cache probes across roles and endpoints

wordpress_vapt.title: CDN/edge misconfiguration leaking private content
wordpress_vapt.description: Improper CDN rules can cache and serve authenticated content publicly.
tests: Probe CDN cache behavior for authenticated pages
Check cache key segmentation by cookies/headers
assurance: No public caching of authenticated content
Cache keys segregate by auth state
remediation: Adjust CDN rules and vary headers

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate CDN cache probes and header audits

wordpress_vapt.title: Cache poisoning via unkeyed parameters
wordpress_vapt.description: Unkeyed query parameters allow attackers to poison shared cache entries.

wordpress_vapt.title: Missing critical security headers
wordpress_vapt.description: Absent CSP, HSTS, X-Frame-Options, and other headers increase exploitability.
tests: Capture response headers for key routes
remediation: Enable HSTS with preload if appropriate

wordpress_vapt.title: Weak or missing Content Security Policy
wordpress_vapt.description: Absent or permissive CSP increases XSS impact and data exfiltration risk.
assurance: Strict CSP applied to sensitive pages

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate CSP audits and inline script probes

wordpress_vapt.title: Admin interface accessible over HTTP
wordpress_vapt.description: Plaintext transport enables credential theft and downgrade attacks.

wordpress_vapt.title: Malware and backdoor persistence
wordpress_vapt.description: Obfuscated code, rogue accounts, and unauthorized cron jobs enable persistent compromise.
tests: Scan for obfuscated PHP and eval/base64_decode patterns
Monitor file integrity and unauthorized changes
remediation: Remove malicious code and rotate credentials
Disable rogue accounts and cron tasks

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate signature scans and account audits

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure cron jobs and scheduled tasks
wordpress_vapt.description: Rogue or misconfigured cron tasks can execute malicious code or exfiltrate data.
tests: Check for unauthorized or obfuscated callbacks
Verify capability checks for task triggers

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate cron inventory and callback audits

wordpress_vapt.title: Supply chain risks in plugins/themes
wordpress_vapt.description: Abandoned or vulnerable extensions introduce exploitable CVEs.
tests: Check CVE databases for installed extensions
Verify update cadence and maintainer activity

wordpress_vapt.title: GDPR/Privacy data protection failures
wordpress_vapt.description: Improper handling of personal data, consent, and deletion requests can cause legal and security exposure.
tests: Verify consent capture and purpose limitation
Audit third-party data sharing and DPA presence
remediation: Implement consent management and audit trails

wordpress_vapt.title: Privacy policy and data mapping gaps
wordpress_vapt.description: Missing disclosures and data inventories hinder compliance and incident response.
tests: Check presence and completeness of privacy policy
Map data flows and storage locations

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate data mapping and policy audits

wordpress_vapt.title: Sensitive data exposure in logs and error output
wordpress_vapt.description: Debug logs and verbose errors can leak credentials, tokens, and personal data.
tests: Check WP_DEBUG and display_errors in production
Probe error paths for stack traces

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate log scans and error probes

references.name: OWASP ASVS
references.section: V6 Data Protection—Sensitive Data in Logs

wordpress_vapt.title: Unencrypted at-rest storage of PII
wordpress_vapt.description: Storing personal data in plaintext increases breach impact.

references.name: NIST SP 800-53
references.section: SC-28 Protection of Information at Rest

wordpress_vapt.title: Server-side request forgery (SSRF)
wordpress_vapt.description: Unvalidated outbound requests can access internal services or metadata endpoints.
tests: Submit URLs to private IP ranges and metadata endpoints
remediation: Block private ranges and metadata endpoints

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate SSRF payloads and verify blocking

wordpress_vapt.title: Misconfigured CORS policies
wordpress_vapt.description: Overly permissive CORS enables cross-domain data leakage.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure GraphQL endpoints
wordpress_vapt.description: Introspection and over-fetching expose sensitive data and increase attack surface.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure API rate limiting
wordpress_vapt.description: Absent or weak rate limiting enables DoS and abuse.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure handling of analytics/marketing scripts
wordpress_vapt.description: Third-party scripts can exfiltrate data or inject tracking without consent.

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate script inventory and CSP audits

wordpress_vapt.title: PCI-DSS non-compliance for e-commerce
wordpress_vapt.description: Improper handling of payment data violates PCI-DSS and increases breach risk.
tests: Check tokenization and no card storage

wordpress_vapt.title: admin-ajax misuse without capability checks
wordpress_vapt.description: AJAX actions without nonce/capability checks allow unauthorized state changes.

wordpress_vapt.title: IDOR on media and private resources
wordpress_vapt.description: Predictable IDs or missing authorization allow access to private media.
tests: Attempt direct access to private media
Check capability checks on download endpoints

wordpress_vapt.title: wp-config.php exposure via misconfiguration
wordpress_vapt.description: Improper server configuration can expose database credentials and salts.
remediation: Move config above webroot if possible

wordpress_vapt.title: WP_DEBUG and verbose errors in production
wordpress_vapt.description: Verbose errors can reveal stack traces, paths, and sensitive data.

wordpress_vapt.title: Default table prefix
wordpress_vapt.description: Default prefixes can aid automated attacks and reconnaissance.

wordpress_vapt.title: Mixed content on authenticated pages
wordpress_vapt.description: Loading HTTP resources on HTTPS pages can leak session data and degrade security.
tests: Scan for mixed content on admin and account pages

wordpress_vapt.title: Plugin/theme update integrity not verified
wordpress_vapt.description: Updates from untrusted sources or without integrity checks can introduce malware.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure JWT handling
wordpress_vapt.description: Improper JWT validation or weak signing algorithms allow token forgery and privilege escalation.

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed .git directories
wordpress_vapt.description: Publicly accessible .git directories leak source code and secrets.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure mail transport
wordpress_vapt.description: Emails sent without TLS or SPF/DKIM/DMARC increase risk of interception and spoofing.

wordpress_vapt.title: Weak password reset flows
wordpress_vapt.description: Predictable or long-lived reset tokens allow account takeover.

wordpress_vapt.title: Directory listing enabled
wordpress_vapt.description: Exposed directory listings leak file names and structure.

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed .env files
wordpress_vapt.description: Publicly accessible .env files can leak database credentials, API keys, and secrets.

wordpress_vapt.title: JWT stored insecurely in localStorage
wordpress_vapt.description: Storing JWTs in localStorage exposes them to XSS attacks.
tests: Check for HttpOnly cookies vs localStorage

wordpress_vapt.title: Weak CAPTCHA implementation
wordpress_vapt.description: CAPTCHA that can be bypassed by bots fails to prevent brute-force attacks.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure analytics SDKs
wordpress_vapt.description: Third-party SDKs may exfiltrate data or introduce vulnerabilities.

wordpress_vapt.title: Excessive cron frequency
wordpress_vapt.description: Overly frequent cron jobs can cause DoS or resource exhaustion.

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed debug endpoints or tools
wordpress_vapt.description: Publicly accessible debug endpoints (e.g., phpinfo, query monitors) leak environment details and secrets.
tests: Check plugin settings for debug exposure
remediation: Restrict debug tools to authenticated admins

wordpress_vapt.title: Missing Subresource Integrity (SRI) on third-party scripts
wordpress_vapt.description: Without SRI, compromised CDNs or script sources can inject malicious code.
tests: Inspect script tags for integrity attributes
remediation: Add integrity attributes to external scripts

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure backup retention and access policies
wordpress_vapt.description: Long retention or broad access to backups increases breach impact and compliance risk.

wordpress_vapt.title: Admin endpoints exposed without additional hardening
wordpress_vapt.description: Predictable admin endpoints increase targeted brute-force and reconnaissance.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insufficient logging and monitoring
wordpress_vapt.description: Lack of actionable logs and alerts delays detection of attacks and persistence.
tests: Review logging coverage for auth, admin actions, file changes

references.name: OWASP Top 10
references.section: A09 Security Logging and Monitoring Failures

wordpress_vapt.title: Admin interface not restricted by CIDR where feasible
wordpress_vapt.description: Lack of network-based restrictions increases exposure to brute-force and scanning.
tests: Check firewall rules for admin paths
Verify CIDR restrictions if policy allows
remediation: Apply CIDR restrictions for admin access
Use VPN or bastion where possible

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed database dumps
wordpress_vapt.description: Publicly accessible .sql or DB exports leak credentials and PII.

wordpress_vapt.title: Nonce leakage via GET or public pages
wordpress_vapt.description: Exposed nonces can be reused to perform CSRF or unauthorized actions.
tests: Check GET usage for state changes

wordpress_vapt.title: Unsanitized post/user meta
wordpress_vapt.description: Untrusted meta fields can lead to stored XSS or logic manipulation.

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed cron endpoints or triggers
wordpress_vapt.description: Publicly accessible cron triggers allow unauthorized task execution.
assurance: Cron triggers protected by auth and nonces

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed stack traces in production
wordpress_vapt.description: Stack traces reveal internal paths and sensitive details.
tests: Inspect error responses for stack traces

wordpress_vapt.title: State-changing admin actions via GET
wordpress_vapt.description: Allowing mutations via GET enables CSRF and unintended actions.

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed plugin settings pages to low-privilege roles
wordpress_vapt.description: Misconfigured capabilities allow unauthorized users to change security-sensitive settings.
tests: Attempt access to plugin settings with low roles

wordpress_vapt.title: Static secrets in code or assets
wordpress_vapt.description: Hardcoded secrets in PHP/JS/CSS or assets can be extracted and abused.
tests: Scan code and assets for secret patterns
Check build pipelines for secret stripping

wordpress_vapt.title: Excessive admin session lifetime
wordpress_vapt.description: Long-lived admin sessions increase hijacking risk and persistence.
tests: Check session TTL for admin roles
assurance: Short TTL and idle timeout for admin sessions

wordpress_vapt.title: Unsafe PHP deserialization
wordpress_vapt.description: Untrusted data passed to unserialize or similar functions can lead to RCE.

references.name: OWASP Top 10
references.section: A08 Software and Data Integrity Failures

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure SSO callback allowlists
wordpress_vapt.description: Overly broad callback URLs enable token theft or account takeover.

wordpress_vapt.title: Unsafe redirects after login
wordpress_vapt.description: Unvalidated post-login redirects enable phishing and session fixation.

references.name: OWASP Top 10
references.section: A01 Broken Access Control (open redirect impact)

wordpress_vapt.title: Unsafe PHP includes from user input
wordpress_vapt.description: Including files based on unsanitized user input can lead to arbitrary code execution.
tests: Scan for include/require using user input
assurance: No dynamic includes from user input

wordpress_vapt.title: Plugin updates without signature verification
wordpress_vapt.description: Unsigned plugin updates may introduce malicious modifications or backdoors.

wordpress_vapt.title: Weak password hashing algorithm used
wordpress_vapt.description: Using outdated or fast hashing like MD5 increases offline cracking feasibility.

wordpress_vapt.title: Open redirect in user profile links
wordpress_vapt.description: Redirects in user-editable URLs can be exploited for phishing.
tests: Inject redirect URLs in profile fields

wordpress_vapt.title: No size limits on form inputs
wordpress_vapt.description: Large input fields can facilitate DoS attacks through memory exhaustion.

wordpress_vapt.title: WordPress version disclosure in HTML/meta tags
wordpress_vapt.description: Exposed WordPress version enables targeted exploits against known vulnerabilities.
tests: Check HTML source for generator meta tag
Verify RSS/Atom feeds for version info
Scan HTTP headers for version strings

wordpress_vapt.title: Publicly accessible readme.html file
wordpress_vapt.description: readme.html reveals WordPress version and installation details to attackers.
tests: Check for other default files (license.txt, wp-config-sample.php)

wordpress_vapt.title: Predictable admin URL disclosure
wordpress_vapt.description: Standard /wp-admin path increases targeted brute-force and reconnaissance.
tests: Probe for common admin path variations

wordpress_vapt.title: PHP error reporting enabled in production
wordpress_vapt.description: Detailed PHP errors expose system paths, variables, and configuration details.
tests: Trigger PHP errors and check output
Check server logs for error verbosity

wordpress_vapt.title: Unnecessary HTTP headers revealing server information
wordpress_vapt.description: Server headers like X-Powered-By expose technology stack to attackers.
remediation: Configure server to suppress version info

wordpress_vapt.title: Default plugin settings exposing unnecessary functionality
wordpress_vapt.description: Plugins with default configurations may expose APIs, debug features, or verbose logging.
tests: Check for exposed APIs or debug interfaces

wordpress_vapt.title: Database table prefix disclosure in error messages
wordpress_vapt.description: SQL errors may reveal table structure including custom prefixes, aiding attacks.
tests: Trigger database errors and analyze output
Check error messages for table names

wordpress_vapt.title: WordPress installation path disclosure
wordpress_vapt.description: Absolute paths in error messages or configuration reveal server structure.
tests: Trigger errors that might show paths
Analyze error logs for path information

wordpress_vapt.title: XML-RPC pingback DDOS amplification vector
wordpress_vapt.description: Pingback functionality can be abused for distributed denial-of-service amplification attacks.
tests: Check rate limiting on pingback requests

wordpress_vapt.title: User enumeration via REST API endpoints
wordpress_vapt.description: REST API allows enumeration of valid usernames through differential responses.
tests: Query REST API with valid/invalid usernames
Analyze response timing and content differences
remediation: Add rate limiting to user endpoints

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure comments settings allowing anonymous posting
wordpress_vapt.description: Comments allowed from anonymous users without moderation increase spam and XSS risks.

wordpress_vapt.title: Known vulnerable plugins/themes not scanned or updated
wordpress_vapt.description: Outdated plugins/themes with known vulnerabilities create exploitable attack surfaces.
tests: Scan installed plugins for known CVEs

wordpress_vapt.title: Database connection not encrypted (SSL/TLS)
wordpress_vapt.description: Unencrypted database connections expose credentials and data to network interception.

wordpress_vapt.title: Admin AJAX actions accessible to unauthenticated users
wordpress_vapt.description: AJAX actions intended for administrators accessible publicly enable unauthorized operations.
tests: Test sensitive AJAX actions without authentication
remediation: Add capability verification for AJAX actions

wordpress_vapt.title: Local/Remote file inclusion vulnerabilities in themes/plugins
wordpress_vapt.description: Dynamic file inclusion based on user input enables arbitrary code execution.
tests: Test file inclusion with malicious paths
Check theme/plugin code for unsafe file operations

wordpress_vapt.title: Insufficient session hijacking prevention mechanisms
wordpress_vapt.description: Lack of session binding to IP/User-Agent increases session hijacking risk.
tests: Test session transfer between different IPs

wordpress_vapt.title: Third-party tracking cookies not properly secured
wordpress_vapt.description: Tracking cookies from third-party services may lack proper security attributes.

wordpress_vapt.title: Weak cryptographic pseudo-random number generation
wordpress_vapt.description: Predictable random numbers in tokens, salts, or identifiers enable exploitation.
tests: Check for cryptographically secure functions usage

wordpress_vapt.title: Open redirect vulnerability in login redirection
wordpress_vapt.description: Login redirect parameter accepts arbitrary URLs enabling phishing attacks.
tests: Test redirect parameter with external URLs

wordpress_vapt.title: Subdomain takeover due to dangling DNS records
wordpress_vapt.description: Orphaned subdomains pointing to deprovisioned services enable hostile takeovers.
tests: Audit DNS records for orphaned subdomains

wordpress_vapt.title: Insufficient clickjacking protection on sensitive pages
wordpress_vapt.description: Missing X-Frame-Options or frame-ancestors CSP directive enables UI redress attacks.
tests: Test framing capabilities on sensitive pages

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure PHP object deserialization in plugins/themes
wordpress_vapt.description: Unserialize() usage on untrusted data enables remote code execution attacks.
tests: Check plugin/theme code for unsafe deserialization

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed phpinfo() output or debug information pages
wordpress_vapt.description: phpinfo() pages reveal detailed server configuration and potential attack vectors.
tests: Probe for phpinfo.php and similar files
Verify access restrictions on info pages
assurance: Access controls enforced on info pages
remediation: Restrict access to debug information pages

wordpress_vapt.title: Weak SSL/TLS configuration exposing protocol vulnerabilities
wordpress_vapt.description: Outdated SSL/TLS protocols and weak cipher suites increase MITM attack risks.
tests: Scan SSL/TLS configuration with SSL Labs
Check supported protocols and cipher suites

wordpress_vapt.title: Broken authentication in password recovery flows
wordpress_vapt.description: Weak password recovery mechanisms enable account takeover through various bypasses.
assurance: Rate limiting applied to recovery flows
remediation: Apply rate limiting to recovery endpoints

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure WordPress cron execution exposing system commands
wordpress_vapt.description: WordPress cron jobs executing system commands without proper validation enable command injection.
tests: Check for shell_exec/system calls in cron tasks
Verify input validation in cron callbacks
assurance: Input sanitization enforced in cron tasks

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed WordPress constants revealing configuration details
wordpress_vapt.description: WordPress constants in HTML/JS expose installation paths and configuration details.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure default configurations in popular plugins
wordpress_vapt.description: Popular plugins with insecure default settings expose functionality unnecessarily.
tests: Check for exposed APIs or debug features

wordpress_vapt.title: Database backup files exposed in web root
wordpress_vapt.description: Database backup files stored in accessible locations expose sensitive data.
tests: Check for .sql, .bak, .dump files in web root
remediation: Implement strict access controls on backups

wordpress_vapt.title: Weak user-agent validation enabling bot traffic
wordpress_vapt.description: Simple user-agent blocking ineffective against sophisticated automated attacks.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure cache control exposing sensitive content
wordpress_vapt.description: Improper cache headers expose authenticated or sensitive content to shared caches.
tests: Check cache headers on authenticated pages
Test shared cache behavior with sensitive content
remediation: Prevent public caching of sensitive content

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed internal APIs without proper access controls
wordpress_vapt.description: Internal APIs accessible externally without authentication enable unauthorized data access.
tests: Test external accessibility of internal APIs
assurance: External access blocked to internal endpoints
remediation: Block external connectivity to internal endpoints

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure comment forms lacking anti-spam protections
wordpress_vapt.description: Comment forms without proper anti-spam measures facilitate comment spam and DoS attacks.
tests: Verify rate limiting on comment submissions
remediation: Enforce rate limiting on comment forms
